page.title: 19The Gardens of Bargany
page.content: The woodland gardens of Bargany contain a large variety of rare and common species of coniferous and deciduous trees. The property originally belonged to the{Kennedy's}as long ago as 1530, passing into the hands of the present family, the{Hamilton's},in 1630. Landscaping the parkland began in the 18th century when landowners became enthusiastic about obtaining new and rare trees from abroad, and some of these trees can be seen today, such as the{Giant Redwood and Noble {Fir.} A large, formal walled garden was laid out in 1833 but only small gardens are now tended, the centre being laid out in grass. Nearby is another garden mostly of special trees,{walnuts, cherries,etc.}with some interesting memorial plaques.
